business.headline: Experts reveal best festive stocks to buy amid global uncertaintyConcerns over global trade talks with the US and new protectionist measures have weighed on investor sentiment
Sensex opens 142 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; BEL gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 114.15 points to 80,540.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 36.45 points to 24,691.15 as of 9:24 am.

Will Zoho go public? Sridhar Vembu says listing may clash with company's visionIn a post on X, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu said that some of Zoho's key projects, such as its messaging app Arattai, would have never been built under the financial pressures faced by public companies.

LIC sees Rs 1,100 crore inflows on Day 1 of GST-free life cover: ReportLife Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) collected over Rs 1,100 crore in inflows on the first day following the removal of GST on individual life insurance policies.
Insured, but where is the protection?Despite the recent reform of zero GST, insurance remains an opaque industry where customers struggle to understand what they're actually buying.

Buying home this festive season? Top things to check before Griha PraveshaFamilies often see this period as the most auspicious time to make a big investment like a home, but experts warn that it is also the stage when due diligence becomes most important.

Nirav Modi's brother-in-law Maiank Mehta pardoned in Rs 13,000 crore PNB scam caseA special CBI court granted pardon to Maiank Mehta, brother-in-law of fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi, in the Rs 13,000 crore Punjab National Bank fraud case.

What to expect from the National Stock Exchange in the next 5 years?Ashish Chauhan, CEO of NSE Chauhan, said the rise in investors and market size over the last decade gives a clear idea of the potential ahead. In 2014, India had just 1.67 crore unique investors. Today, there are about 12 crore investors.

50% tariffs and growth: Why India must focus on reform, not retaliationAt the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts called for reforms, investment-led growth, and targeted support for vulnerable sectors to navigate challenges from steep US tariffs.

Explained: Why Dalal Street has an edge over global stock marketsAt the India Today Conclave in Mumbai, Ashish Chauhan, CEO of the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE), explained why India's markets and economy hold a stronger position for the future compared to others.

From 50% tariffs to growth: Why India needs reforms, not retaliationAs the US slaps steep tariffs on Indian goods, the debate is shifting from retaliation to reform. Experts at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025 say India should use this moment to push for deeper reforms that fuel investment and boost domestic demand.
How to invest in pharma and IT stocks during current slowdownWith the US announcing fresh tariffs on branded drugs and uncertainty around H-1B visa rules, both sectors are experiencing headwinds.

India-US trade talks advance amid tariff and energy discussionsIndia-US trade discussions are gaining momentum, with both nations exploring ways to enhance economic cooperation, address tariffs, and boost energy trade.

Sensex tumbles 733 points as pharma, IT stocks hitThe sell-off came after the United States announced a steep 100% tariff on imports of branded and patented pharmaceutical products, effective October 1.

Indian air passengers rise to 131.7 lakh in August 2025 amid rising costs: ReportIndia's aviation sector is bouncing back, but the journey isn't without turbulence. Rising fuel costs, operational challenges, and financial pressures are testing airlines, even as passenger traffic shows steady growth.

Sensex tanks 800 points: Why is stock market falling today?By 2:37 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex had lost 782.71 points to trade at 80,376.97, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 247.10 points to 24,643.75. Both indices were on track to end the week in negative territory.

Investors brace for IPO wave as 18 public listings hit Dalal Street next weekThe four mainboard IPOs opening next week together aim to raise over Rs 850 crore. Apart from them, 14 SME IPOs will also open for bidding next week.

Why more insurance policyholders are turning to private grievance platformsAs claim rejections soar and official channels frustrate, policyholders turn to private grievance platforms. Experts warn regulatory reform and competent brokers could restore trust in India's struggling insurance system.

From EMIs to assets: How home loans are creating India's new wealth generationIn India, home loans are doing more than financing houses—they are quietly shaping the country's next generation of wealth. Every EMI paid is becoming a step toward financial growth and stability.

Crypto in slump. 3 reasons why Bitcoin, Ethereum and Dogecoin are strugglingThe cryptocurrency market is struggling, and major tokens are taking the hit. Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin have all dropped as investors react to a mix of macroeconomic uncertainty, liquidations, and upcoming market events.

EPFO 3.0 roll-out likely delayed, ATM withdrawals pushed to 2026The wait for EPFO 3.0 just got longer. While the update is set to make provident fund services more seamless, its highlight feature, ATM withdrawals, is now likely to come into effect in 2026.

Why Trump's MAGA is impossible without Indian CEOsThe list of Indian-origin CEOs in global technology and beyond is long and growing. Satya Nadella leads Microsoft, Sundar Pichai is at Alphabet and Google, Arvind Krishna heads IBM, Shantanu Narayen runs Adobe, and Neal Mohan was appointed YouTube CEO in 2023.

Trump slaps 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.
Dalal Street outlook: Is market entering a consolidation phase?

Cipla, Dr. Reddy's, Sun Pharma: Why pharma stocks are falling todayAt 9:39 am, Sun Pharma fell 2.94% to Rs 1,548, Cipla dropped 1.92% to Rs 1,475, and Dr. Reddy's Laboratories slipped 1.17% to Rs 1,275. The sector's decline added to the broader weakness in equity markets.

Pharma stocks drag stock markets lower after Trump's 100% drug tariff threatAt 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 240.39 points at 80,919.29, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 86.30 points to 24,804.55. Broader market indices also mirrored the weakness.

Exclusive: Adani set to acquire Sahara's crown jewel assets in landmark dealThe deal stems from a long-running dispute ongoing before the Supreme Court led by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) against key Sahara entities, requiring them to refund investor money.

Ananya Birla on building Swatantra, making music, and leading with valuesWhether running businesses, writing songs, or leading teams, Ananya Birla believes in giving her all. Speaking at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she reflected on her early start, her discipline, and the values that guide her.

Ananya Birla on balancing business, music, and leadershipAnanya Birla wears many hats - entrepreneur, musician, and leader. At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she shared how discipline, values, and passion have helped her navigate each role with purpose.

CBDT extends deadline for filing income tax audit reports to October 31CBDT said the move comes in response to representations from professional bodies, including Chartered Accountant associations, highlighting difficulties in completing audit reports on time.

Sensex tumbles over 500 points, Nifty falls below 25,000The Nifty 50 slipped 0.66% to 24,890.85, while the BSE Sensex eased 0.68% to 81,159.68, logging their longest losing run since early March. Over the past five sessions, the Nifty and Sensex have fallen 2.1% and 2.2%, respectively.

Stock market investing: Can AI really beat human experts?At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts discussed how AI is changing stock market investing, whether it can replace traditional methods, and what role human judgement will continue to play.

How not to lose money on the stock market? Experts answer at India Today ConclaveWith increasing participation in equities, especially after the strong returns of the past few years, experts mentioned the importance of patience, asset allocation and realistic expectations.

World's second-richest man pledges to give away 95% of his $373 billion fortuneMuch of his philanthropy is channelled through the Ellison Institute of Technology (EIT), a for-profit organisation based at the University of Oxford. EIT works on global challenges such as healthcare, climate change, food insecurity, and AI research.

Where are Indians heading this festive season? Top destinations revealedCurious where Indians are planning to travel this festive season? From bustling international cities to iconic domestic spots, these are the destinations topping the list.

Festive gold rush: Should you buy jewellery or gold stocks this season?Indians love buying gold, especially in the festive season. However, Dalal Street has also seen an upward trend, with positive domestic developments such as GST rate cuts and income tax reforms earlier in the year.

Court questions Priya Kapur's plea to disclose Sunjay Kapur assets in sealed coverThe application was filed in the ongoing inheritance dispute involving Karisma Kapoor's children, who are claiming a share in their late father's personal assets.
Gold slips from record high. 3 factors explainedGold retreated from its record peak this week, leaving investors curious about what triggered the fall. Here are three key factors behind the dip.

Insurance complaints surge 45% in Q2 as health policies drive cases: ReportRising disputes reveal persistent mis-selling and transparency gaps in India's insurance sector, with policyholders increasingly turning to platforms like Insurance Samadhan to assert rights and seek timely redressal.

Missed the ITR deadline? You will now have to file under new tax regimeWondering what happens if you miss the ITR filing deadline? Did you know you'll automatically be shifted to the new tax regime, losing the option to choose the old one?

entertainment.headline: Bobby Deol to burn Raavan effigy at Red Fort on Dussehra Actor Bobby Deol will participate in the traditional Raavan Dahan ceremony at Delhi's Red Fort on October 2, as part of the Luv Kush Ramlila celebrations.

Samantha Ruth Prabhu opens up on love, self-acceptance amid relationship rumours Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared a heartfelt Instagram note on embracing authenticity in her thirties, contrasting it with the restless pace of her twenties. She also talked about love amid relationship rumours.

Rapper Bad Bunny to headline 2026 Super Bowl halftime show Puerto Rican artist Bad Bunny will lead the 2026 Apple Music Super Bowl LX Halftime Show, marking his second performance at the event and highlighting his global influence and cultural impact.

India lifts Asia Cup: Amitabh Bachchan to Mammootty, celebs congratulate team India defeated Pakistan by five wickets in the Asia Cup 2025 final. Amitabh Bachchan, Mammootty, Anil Kapoor, Preity Zinta and several other celebrities publicly celebrated the win by posting congratulatory messages.

Priyanka Chopra's new photo dump features Nick, Malti, Ishaan Khatter, Dia Mirza Priyanka Chopra shared her New York photo dump featuring Nick Jonas, daughter Malti, and industry friends, calling it "a little fall moment with the people you love." She spent quality time with Ishaan Khatter and Dia Mirza.

Jr NTR says Kantara Chapter 1 would be humanly impossible without Rishab Shetty Jr NTR praised Rishab Shetty's extraordinary vision and hard work during the Telugu pre-release event of 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. Despite his recent injury, he expressed deep admiration for the film's scale and cultural significance.

43 kisses to best papa Ranbir: Raha's birthday gift and Alia Bhatt's Insta wish Ranbir Kapoor celebrated his 43rd birthday with a special promise from his daughter Raha. Alia Bhatt shared a few glimpses of his birthday from their short holiday.

Angad Bedi spends best evening with Sachin Tendulkar, Virender Sehwag and friends Angad Bedi enjoyed one of the most memorable evenings in the best company of cricketing legends, Sachin Tendulkar and Virender Sehwag. Neha Dhupia, his actor-wife, left a hilarious comment on his Instagram post.

Awez Darbar gets evicted from Bigg Boss 19 Digital influencer Awez Darbar has been evicted from 'Bigg Boss 19'. He, along with Pranit More, Ashnoor Kaur, Gaurav Khanna, Neelam Giri and Mridul Tiwari, were nominated for eviction this week.

8-year-old TV actor Veer Sharma, brother die in apartment fire in Rajasthan's Kota A sudden fire broke out in a flat in Kota's Transport Nagar area on Sunday, claiming the lives of two children -- eight-year-old television actor Veer Sharma and his 16-year-old brother, Shoriya Sharma.

Ranbir Kapoor cuts huge cake on 43rd birthday, greets paps; video goes viral Ranbir Kapoor celebrated his 43rd birthday with fans, family, and the media, stepping out to cut a cake with paparazzi and receiving warm wishes from Neetu Kapoor and Soni Razdan. A rare video message from the actor, featuring his daughter Raha's voice in the background, added a special touch to the celebrations.

Pawan Kalyan's They Call Him OG reaches Rs 200 crore globally: Trade report They Call Him OG is Power Star Pawan Kalyan's first film to cross the 200-crore mark at the box office worldwide, and the film has done so in three days according to trade report

My Queen, My Precious: Ali Fazal shares loved-up post for wife Richa Chadha Ali Fazal wrote a sweet note for wife Richa Chadha on Instagram, calling her "My Queen, My Precious", leaving the actor touched.

Gauahar Khan, Zaid Darbar share first glimpse of their second son, reveal name Gauahar Khan and Zaid Darbar have named their newborn son Farwaan, nearly a month after his birth on September 1. The actor shared the announcement with a sweet photo of her elder son Zehaan introducing his little brother.

Ektaa Kapoor says entourage is killing films, calls censor much-needed trouble Ektaa Kapoor, the queen of Indian TV, discussed women breaking industry norms, challenges like censor rules and entourage costs, and affirms TV's strength in the digital era as she readies the new season of 'Naagin'.

PM Modi pays tributes to Lata Mangeshkar and Zubeen Garg in Mann Ki Baat PM Modi paid an emotional tribute to playback legend Lata Mangeshkar on her birthday on Sunday, and hailed late singer Zubeen Garg during his radio show, Mann Ki Baat

120 Bahadur teaser out as special tribute on Lata Mangeshkar's birth anniversary To mark Lata Mangeshkar's birth anniversary, the makers of '120 Bahadur' released a poignant teaser featuring her iconic song 'Ae Mere Watan Ke Logon'. The film, set during the Rezang La battle, will release in November.

Ram Charan celebrates 18 years in cinema, Peddi makers release special poster Tollywood star Ram Charan celebrates 18 years in cinema, with his upcoming film 'Peddi' marking the milestone by releasing a special poster. The film, starring Janhvi Kapoor and featuring music by A.R. Rahman, is halfway through production and has already secured a massive OTT deal.

Punjabi singer Rajvir Jawanda hospitalised in critical condition after bike accident Punjabi singer Rajvir Jawanda is in critical condition after a motorcycle accident in Himachal Pradesh, sustaining severe head and spine injuries and requiring ventilator support. Fans, fellow artists, and political leaders have expressed concern and prayed for his speedy recovery.

general news.headline: Deeply concerned: X to challenge High Court order to comply with takedown noticesX announced it would appeal against a Karnataka High Court order enforcing compliance with takedown notices, warning it enables arbitrary directives by millions of police officers and threatens free expression.

Photo op or pep talk? Trump's surprise entry at top generals' meet sparks buzzLast week, Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth summoned hundreds of generals and admirals, including senior commanders of the one-star rank or higher and their top advisers, to the Marine Corps base in Quantico, Virginia, with little notice.

Karur stampede: High Court to hear Vijay's TVK's plea today amid blame gameTVK has filed a plea before the Madras High Court's Madurai Bench seeking a CBI or SIT probe into the tragedy, while a victim has moved the court to restrain the party from holding further rallies.

No trophy, no problem: Surya leads Asia Cup celebration with photoshopped picsIndia stars added a trophy emoticon to their celebration pics to mock Mohsin Naqvi after the PCB chief ran away with the Asia Cup title on Sunday, September 28. The Indian players said they won't accept the trophy from Naqvi at the post-match presentation.

Asia Cup: India win. Pakistan do a Pakistan. Cricket suffersAsia Cup 2025 promised tension, yet the final sank to an unprecedented low when India, the victors, were denied the trophy. Celebrations continued in an empty stadium, but the episode showed how egos and off-field drama can overshadow the game. If this becomes the template for India-Pakistan clashes, cricket itself will bear the cost.

Wailing father carrying son's body – Gut-wrenching video of Karur stampede tragedyHeart-wrenching cries amid the eerie silence of death filled Karur General Hospital on Saturday evening as both the injured and the dead were rushed in from the stampede site at Vijay's political rally. Among the victims were several children. A haunting visual of a grief-stricken father carrying his lifeless child at the hospital stood as a stark testimony to the horror of the evening.

By Sunday evening, the death toll in the stampede now stood at 40 with 10 children.

Will Zoho go public? Sridhar Vembu says listing may clash with company's visionIn a post on X, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu said that some of Zoho's key projects, such as its messaging app Arattai, would have never been built under the financial pressures faced by public companies.

How Kolkata's Durga Puja stage has a new political actor in Abhishek BanerjeeFor Abhishek, who keeps a low profile during Puja season, the decision signals both the countdown to Bengal polls and his gradual assumption of command of the TMC

Videos capture moments of panic, tragedy of Karur stampedeHarrowing videos from the Karur rally captured the horror of the deadly stampede, showing grieving parents with lifeless children, frantic cries, and shock-stricken crowds as dozens, including women and children, lost their lives.

'Everyone's mother dies': UCO Bank official accused of toxic conduct in viral emailThe email, addressed to UCO Bank's top management, was titled "Complaint Regarding Inhuman and Toxic Behavior by Zonal Head, Chennai – Request for Immediate Action."

Boy hung upside down, beaten at Haryana school; case against principal, staffPolice have booked the driver under serious IPC sections and the Juvenile Justice Act, while the incident has triggered outrage over child safety and corporal punishment in schools.

Live: Deaths during Vijay's Karur rally rise to 41Vijay rally stampede updates: At least 40 people died, and many others were injured after a stampede broke out during a political rally of TVK chief Vijay in Tamil Nadu's Karur on Saturday evening. The victims included women and children, while those who fainted during the commotion were taken to the nearest hospital for treatment. The Tamil Nadu government announced Rs 10 lakh each for the families of the victims, and also constituted an enquiry commission to probe the incident. Stay tuned for the latest updates.
Insured, but where is the protection?Despite the recent reform of zero GST, insurance remains an opaque industry where customers struggle to understand what they're actually buying.

Kanpur police arrest ex-cop in 'I love Muhammad' row, Samajwadi Party links emergeKanpur police have arrested ex-constable Zubair Khan, accused of inciting violence. His photographs with SP's Kanpur district president Fazal Mehmood have now gone viral on social media, sparking political debate over his affiliations.

All on board for something special: Trump's big hint on Middle EastUS President Donald Trump hinted at significant progress on the Middle East crisis and a possible Gaza deal. The discussions may impact the ongoing war and hostage negotiations.

WhatsApp meets its match? Arattai races to no 1 in India app storesArattai has surpassed WhatsApp and surges to the top of India's app stores. The app's success highlights growing user demand for local digital platforms amid global scrutiny of the tech industry.

43 kisses to best papa Ranbir: Raha's birthday gift and Alia Bhatt's Insta wishRanbir Kapoor celebrated his 43rd birthday with a special promise from his daughter Raha. Alia Bhatt shared a few glimpses of his birthday from their short holiday.

Why fresher hiring in Indian IT is muted despite bigger talent pool from H1B curbsThe broad outlook is that headwinds and macroeconomic uncertainties will continue to hit the intake of freshers by the IT sector

4 dead, 8 injured in Michigan church shooting; gunman was Iraq war veteranPolice say Sanford, 40, of Burton, Michigan, killed four and injured eight others while opening fire on congregants of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc, Michigan. Authorities have provided no motive for the attack yet.

Suryakumar Yadav pledges his entire Asia Cup match fee to Indian armyIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav announced he will donate all Asia Cup 2025 match fees to the Indian Army following their victory over Pakistan. The triumph was overshadowed by India refusing to accept the trophy from Pakistan's interior minister Mohsin Naqvi, creating unprecedented controversy.

Karur disaster was foretold. Vijay's team knew of stampede risk over a year agoA stampede at TVK chief and superstar Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur killed 40 people. About 1.5 years ago, Vijay's team members told India Today Digital that getting Thalapathy Vijay to campaign would be a challenge given the fan frenzy surrounding him. They knew of the stampede risk. Even political observers feared it. The real tragedy is that 40 lives were lost despite this awareness. As politician Vijay can't give up campaigning, preparedness will be the key in a country that is prone to crowd surges and stampedes.

Ladakh under attack by BJP: Rahul Gandhi backs statehood demand, Sonam WangchukOn September 24, peaceful protests being held under the leadership of activist Songam Wangchuk turned violent as protesters resorted to arson and vandalism by torching the local BJP office and a few vehicles.

Watch: Gambhir goes wild, slams table in delight as Tilak whacks Rauf for sixIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir was seen at his ecstatic best as he slammed the table in delight after Tilak Varma's massive six against Haris Rauf in the Asia Cup final against Pakistan.

Suryakumar plays down horror run in Asia Cup: Not out of form, just short of runsSuryakumar Yadav dismissed concerns about his form after India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph, stressing he is only short on runs. The skipper remains confident his preparation and leadership will soon translate into match-winning performances with the bat.

sports.headline: You're getting angry: Surya shuts down salty Pakistan reporter with witty remark Suryakumar Yadav shut down a Pakistan reporter who questioned the Indian team's behaviour towards Pakistan during the Asia Cup 2025. India defeated Pakistan to win the title on Sunday, September 28.

Cricket was played in Asia Cup final. Tilak's day in the sun is proof of it Asia Cup final, India vs Pakistan: Long before the trophy fiasco unfolded at the Dubai stadium, Tilak Varma had crafted a masterclass knock against Pakistan in the high-pressure final, ensuring that cricket remained the true protagonist of the day.

Clairvoyants Tilak and Rinku willed on Sept 6 exactly what they would do in final India players Tilak Varma and Rinku Singh made their manifestations come true with a breathtaking display in the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan. Tilak anchored the innings with a brilliant 69 off 53 balls, while Rinku, getting to play for the first time in the tournament, was there to hit the winning runs on Sunday.

Ex-Pakistan captain calls for India's suspension after ugly day in final Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif slammed India for refusing to accept the Asia Cup 2025 trophy from ACC Chairman Mohsin Naqvi, calling it an "ugly day for cricket" and urging the ICC to consider suspension.

Asian champions India best team in the T20 format: Sunil Gavaskar Sunil Gavaskar claimed that India are the best team in the world when it comes to the T20 format after their thrilling win against Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025 final on Sunday, September 28.

India disrespected cricket: Pak captain on Asia Cup handshake row, trophy dramaPakistan cricket captain Salman Agha criticised India in the post-match press conference after the Asia Cup final. Agha claimed that India were disrespecting cricket.

PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi ran away with Asia Cup trophy, says BCCI secretaryBCCI secretary Devajit Saikia took a sharp dig at PCB head Mohsin Naqvi after the Asia Cup final on Sunday. He said that Naqvi went away to his hotel room with the Asia Cup trophy after India won the title by beating Pakistan.

Asia Cup champions India were denied trophy: Suryakumar YadavThe Indian team did not lift the winner's trophy after the final of the Asia Cup 2025. Asked what happened, Suryakumar Yadav said that the Indian team were denied the Asia Cup trophy by Asian Cricket Council, the organisers of the tournament.

Watch: India celebrate Asia Cup win without trophy on stage in DubaiAsia Cup champions India on Sunday refused to accept the winners' trophy from ACC chairman Mohsin Naqvi, who is also Pakistan's interior minister and chairman of the country's cricket board. The Indian players celebrated with their fans, posed for photographs, but left the stadium without the trophy, creating a striking image of champions without their silverware.

India refuse Asia Cup trophy from PCB chief, celebrate empty-handed on stageAsia Cup 2025 final, Ind vs Pak: In one of the most bizarre scenes in cricket history, the victorious Indian team celebrated without the trophy on the dais in Dubai. Suryakumar Yadav said India were denied the trophy after it emerged that the team refused to collect it from Pakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi.

Asia Cup: BCCI announces Rs 21 crore cash reward for victorious Indian teamThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) declared a cash reward of Rs 21 crore for the Indian squad and support staff after Suryakumar Yadav's men defeated Pakistan by five wickets in a thrilling Asia Cup 2025 final, securing their ninth continental title on Sunday.

Op Sindoor on games field: PM Modi celebrates India beating Pak in Asia Cup finalPrime Minister Narendra Modi termed India's five-wicket win over Pakistan in the Asia Cup final as "Operation Sindoor on the games field," saying the outcome remained the same - India wins - as he congratulated the Indian cricketers.

Ind 3-0 Pak. Tilak Varma special inspires India to 9th Asia Cup crownIndia vs Pakistan, Asia Cup 2025 Final: After a riveting display from their spinners, India overcame a top-order collapse to chase down 147 in Dubai. Pakistan paid the price for a reckless batting performance, going down to their arch-rivals for the third successive time in the tournament - including in the game that mattered most.

Exclusive: Harbhajan Singh on Hardik Pandya not playing Asia Cup finalIn the cricket final between India and Pakistan, a key development is Hardik Pandya's injury, leading to his replacement by Rinku Singh. This has prompted a significant strategic shift, with India entering the match with only one specialist fast bowler, Jasprit Bumrah. On India Today, World Cup winner Harbhajan Singh analysed the decision, stating, "I would have liked to see Arshadip along with Jasprit Bumrah, to be honest." He pointed out that India's win of the toss and decision to chase is a crucial advantage that helps compensate for the altered bowling lineup. The discussion also covered captain Suryakumar Yadav's inconsistent form, the pitch conditions favouring a lower score, and Harbhajan's prediction of an Indian victory.

IND vs PAK: Suryakumar Yadav flops again, draws flak for horrendous run in Asia CupIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav failed to make an impact in the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan. Suryakumar has been in poor form ever since being appointed India's full-time captain.

Watch: Jasprit Bumrah gives it back to Haris Rauf with crashing-jet celebrationAsia Cup final, IND vs PAK: Jasprit Bumrah dismissed Haris Rauf with a near-perfect yorker in the Asia Cup final. His fighter-jet celebration responded to Rauf's earlier gesture, intensifying the off-field tensions between the two teams.

After ICC warning, Sahibzada snubs rifle celebration despite fifty vs IndiaPakistan's opening batter scored a quick 57 against India in the Asia Cup 2025 final. His silent celebration and key wicket by Varun Chakaravarthy added drama to the high-stakes match.

India go in Asia Cup final without Pandya, fans question team combinationIndia will play the Asia Cup 2025 final without all-rounder Hardik Pandya due to injury. The team's altered bowling strategy has sparked debate among fans ahead of the summit clash.

Two captains, two presenters: IND vs PAK Asia Cup final features rare double-actThe Asia Cup 2025 final showcased a rare double-act with two captains and presenters at the toss. India went on to win the toss and chose to bowl first in the title-clash

Suryakumar snubs handshake and trophy photoshoot with Pakistan captainAsia Cup 2025 final: India captain Suryakumar Yadav avoided shaking hands with Pakistan skipper Salman Ali Agha for the third time in the tournament. Also, Salman posed with the trophy alone before the toss on Sunday in Dubai.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
